sentences: He charted for the first time in 2004 with the single "Riding' with the Legend", which Bryant co-wrote as a tribute to former NASCAR driver Dale Earnhardt, who died in 2001.
He charted for the first time in 2004 with the single "Riding' with the Legend", which Bryant co-wrote as a tribute to former NASCAR driver Dale Earnhardt, who died in 2001.
In 2000, Bryant released his first solo album, The Secret to Life.
A second album, Welcome to Love, followed two years later.
By 2004, he had signed to Lofton Creek Records to release his third album, Ridin' with the Legend.
Its title track was a tribute to Dale Earnhardt, a NASCAR driver who died in 2001.
The song received airplay on country radio for ten months, in addition to spending fifteen weeks on the Billboard Hot Country Songs charts, where it peaked at No. 47.

Bryant's fourth album, Live It Slow, followed in 2007 on the S&S Mack label.
